author: elpilon@pulzo-hermes.com
title: Valledupar, en desempleo, saliÃ³ del top 10 en Colombia, segÃºn el Dane
text: El desempleo sigue cediendo en Valledupar. De acuerdo con el [Departamento Administrativo Nacional de EstadÃ­stica (Dane)](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/dane) para el mes de noviembre la tasa de desocupaciÃ³n en la capital cesarense fue de 10,6 %, mientras que hace un aÃ±o era de 14,5 %. (Le puede interesar: [Alarma por cambios en contratos a tÃ©rmino fijo en Colombia: muchos perderÃ­an sus puestos](https://www.pulzo.com/economia/reforma-laboral-cambios-claves-contratos-termino-fijo-PP3323036A)) Es decir, la reducciÃ³n fue de 3,9 puntos porcentuales, tendencia a la baja que ha sido registrada en los Ãºltimos meses en el municipio [y de igual manera a nivel nacional](https://www.pulzo.com/economia/tasa-desempleo-colombia-bajo-9--noviembre-segun-datos-dian-PP3350249A), cuyo porcentaje total pasÃ³ de 9,5 a 9 %, el mÃ¡s bajo del aÃ±o. De 23 ciudades y Ã¡reas metropolitanas, [Valledupar](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/valledupar) ocupÃ³ el puesto 11, saliendo asÃ­ de las 10 primeras casillas en las que se mantuvo en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os por el nÃºmero de personas sin un puesto de trabajo dentro del ranking de la entidad estadÃ­stica. En el primer y segundo lugar estÃ¡n QuibdÃ³ y Riohacha, respectivamente. Si bien los datos del 2023 demuestran una considerable variaciÃ³n respecto de noviembre de 2022, en materia de formalidad laboral la ciudad aÃºn tiene muchos retos, puesto que se mantiene en el segundo de 23 lugares por su proporciÃ³n de poblaciÃ³n ocupada de manera informal que es el 64,3 %. (Lea tambiÃ©n: [Siguen cayendo las licencias de construcciÃ³n en Colombia; Dane revelÃ³ dato desalentador](https://www.pulzo.com/economia/construcciones-colombia-licencia-siguen-cayendo-segun-dane-PP3341703A)) No obstante, en la Ãºltima anualidad registrÃ³ una caÃ­da de 5 puntos porcentuales, teniendo en cuenta que en noviembre de 2022 la proporciÃ³n era de 69,2. En primer lugar por informalidad estÃ¡ Sincelejo. [Habitantes de ciudad colombiana tendrÃ¡n que alistar bolsillo por alza en carreras de taxis](/economia/precio-carreras-taxis-valledupar-subira-precio-2024-cuanto-PP3350435A) [Perro cayÃ³ de un quinto piso en Valledupar; tendrÃ­a varias horas bajo el Sol](/nacion/valledupar-hoy-perro-cayo-quinto-piso-intentado-escapar-calor-PP3349156A) [En memoria de las cinco vÃ­ctimas de feminicidio que enlutaron a Valledupar en 2023](/nacion/durante-2023-valledupar-cinco-mujeres-fueron-victimas-feminicidio-PP3347468A) [Ojo si va de vacaciones a estos municipios de Colombia: se dispararon casos de dengue](/nacion/municipios-colombia-con-mayor-casos-dengue-ano-nuevo-PP3346864A) El [desempleo](https://www.pulzo.com/noticias/desempleo) anual juvenil en la Capital Mundial del Vallenato tambiÃ©n bajÃ³: de 24,5 % a 18,6 por ciento, es decir, 6 puntos. Esta tasa evidencia lo que padecen los vallenatos entre los 15 y los 28 aÃ±os es la dÃ©cima mÃ¡s alta del paÃ­s. LO ÃšLTIMO [EconomÃ­a] Hace 1 mins [Las mejores pÃ¡ginas para encontrar trabajo remoto en espaÃ±ol; comodidad y buenos salarios](/economia/cuales-mejores-paginas-para-encontrar-trabajo-remoto-espanol-PP3351504) [EconomÃ­a] Hace 12 mins [Empresarios, preocupados por aumento del 12 % del salario mÃ­nimo que anunciÃ³ Petro](/economia/salario-minimo-2024-empresarios-preocupados-aumento-12-PP3351812A) [EconomÃ­a]

author: Bangkok Post Public Company Limited
title: Chadchart wants B9m for seismographs
text:
Bangkok governor Chadchart Sittipunt will propose a 9-million-baht budget for procuring earthquake measurement devices for eight high-rise hospitals.
Mr Chadchart said the attempt follows the Bangkok City Council's rejection of a similar proposal in September 2023. He said the proposal would be presented again, as the previous rejection likely stemmed from a lack of perceived urgency.
"Many may not have understood the importance of the project at that time. It's understandable, as large earthquakes have not been felt in the area for a while. However, with recent developments, perspectives may have shifted," he said. He said the request could be included in the 2026 fiscal budget or could be paid for through central government funds.
The project aims to install earthquake-monitoring devices in high-rises at eight Bangkok hospitals, including the Thani Nopparat Building at City Hall in Din Daeng area, which is 37 storeys tall, and other buildings such as the 72nd Anniversary Building at Charoenkrung Pracharak Hospital (24 storeys) and the Somdet Chao Phraya Taksin Maharat Building at Taksin Hospital (17 storeys).
The total cost would be nine million baht, a modest sum given the importance of the data the devices would provide, he said.
Mr Chadchart expressed hope that, if feasible, the number of installations could be expanded beyond the hospitals initially proposed.
"This technology is now more affordable and can provide valuable data for analysis. Installing these devices in both government agencies and private entities will increase data reliability and public confidence," he said.

author: Reuters
title: Outrage after Italian church puts up same-sex nativity scene featuring two mothers of baby Jesus | The Independent
text: A same-sex church nativity scene featuring two mothers of Baby Jesus sparked anger among conservative Catholics and politicians in Italy who called the display â€œdangerous, as well as shameful and blasphemousâ€. Nativity scenes are popular in the largely Catholic country, but in recent years they have been increasingly mired in culture wars as its society becomes more secular and multi-cultural.The priest at the Church of Saints Peter and Paul, in Capocastello di Mercogliano, a hamlet in the province of Avellino about one hourâ€™s drive east of Naples, defended the unique depiction of the birth of Jesus instead of the conventional Mary and Joseph figurines.â€œI wanted to show with this scene that families are no longer just the traditional ones,â€ Father Vitaliano Della Sala told Reuters.â€œIn our parishes we see more and more children from the new types of families that exist and are part of our society, children of separated and divorced people, gay couples, single people, young mothers.â€Father Della Sala, known in Italy for sympathising with LGBT and left-wing causes, says his attitude is in line with that of Pope Francis, who this week, in a landmark ruling, allowed priests to bless same-sex couples.But senator Maurizio Gasparri of the co-ruling Forza Italia party said the LGBT creche â€œoffends all those who always had respect and devotion for the Holy Familyâ€.The Pro-Vita & Famiglia (Pro-Life and Family) group called it â€œdangerous, as well as shameful and blasphemousâ€.Pro-Vita, which launched an online petition calling on the bishop of Avellino to intervene, said the nativity scene contradicted the Churchâ€™s teachings on the family and legitimised same-sex parenting and surrogacy.The petition has so far attracted more than 21,000 signatories.Having children through surrogacy is illegal in Italy, and parliament is discussing a government-sponsored law that would also criminalise couples who resort to the practice by going abroad.This week, a senator from Prime Minister Giorgia Meloniâ€™s Brothers of Italy party proposed another bill that would prevent school directors from halting Catholic-themed activities such as Christmas plays or the making of nativity scenes. Additional reporting by agencies FILE: The San Anton Church integrated Aylan into the traditional Bethlehem scene to raise awareness of the plight of refugeesWant

author: TiscaliNews
title: Niente Dante a scuola, scoppia caso studenti islamici - Tiscali Notizie
text: Sulla decisione, presa dal prof all'insaputa della dirigenza scolastica, si Ã¨ scatenato un putiferio Un inferno, come nella Divina Commedia. Ãˆ un caso che infiamma anche la politica quello dei due studenti musulmani di terza media di Treviso esentati dallo studio della Divina Commedia di Dante, che potrebbe risultare offensiva per chi abbraccia l'Islam. Sulla decisione, presa dal prof all'insaputa della dirigenza scolastica, si Ã¨ scatenato un putiferio (a senso unico): tutti contro lo zelo eccessivo dell'insegnante. PerchÃ¨ la dispensa da Inferno, Purgatorio e Paradiso non Ã¨ arrivata dopo una protesta; Ã¨ stato il professore a scrivere ai genitori dei due ragazzi, chiedendo se c'erano problemi nell'affrontare con i loro i figli l'opera a sfondo religioso del grande Alighieri. Le famiglie hanno risposto che andava evitato. La vicenda resta ancora un po' fumosa. Il docente avrebbe cercato di insistere, cedendo poi davanti al 'niet' delle famiglie. La stessa lettera l'aveva inviata ai genitori di altri alunni che non fanno religione a scuola. Il ragionamento dev'essere stato questo: un testo impregnato di religione cattolica potrebbe urtare la sensibilitÃ  di chi non crede, o abbraccia altre fedi. Per i due ragazzi Ã¨ stato organizzato un programma alternativo su Boccaccio. Il ministro: "L'esclusione Ã¨ inammissibile" Appena appresa la notizia, il ministro dell'istruzione Giuseppe Valdidata ha deciso l'invido di ispettori all'istituto trevigiano, il 'Felissent', "per verificare come stanno i fatti". "L'esclusione dal programma scolastico di uno dei pilastri della nostra letteratura, per motivi religiosi o culturali, ancora non abbiamo ben capito, Ã¨ del tutto inammissibile". Ãˆ seguita una cascata di commenti, da maggioranza e opposizione, increduli sul fatto che Dante possa 'turbare' qualcuno. "Ãˆ un'assurditÃ  cancellare Dante. Ma dietro questo si nasconde un problema ancora piÃ¹ grande: l'integralismo" ha dichiarato il presidente veneto, Luca Zaia, mentre il sindaco di Treviso (e collega di partito) Mario Conte, ha giudicato la scelta "incomprensibile". Ancora piÃ¹ diretti il leader della Lega, Matteo Salvini - "Ã¨ demenziale non studiare Dante perchÃ¨ offende qualcuno" - e il ministro turismo Daniela SantanchÃ¨: "Dante? Continuiamo a sottometterci ai musulmani' Questi politicamente corretti li avrebbe messi tra gli ignavi". Vannacci: "Vogliono distruggere la nostra Italia" Tra i giudizi piÃ¹ severi, quello del generale-candidato Roberto Vannacci: "eccoli - ha detto - quelli che vogliono distruggere la nostra Italia e la nostra identitÃ ". Anche dall'opposizione la musica non Ã¨ stata diversa. "Conoscere Dante non toglie nulla alla confessione religiosa dei ragazzi ma aggiunge molto alla conoscenza della cultura italiana. Integrazione si fa per aggiunta, mai per sottrazione" ha scritto su X la senatrice Pd Simona Malpezzi, mentre Deborah Serracchiani si Ã¨ detta incredula "che si possa mettere in discussione lo studio nelle scuole della Divina Commedia, un patrimonio dell'umanitÃ  imprescindibile per qualunque formazione culturale non solo italiana". Negativo anche il parere degli scrittori Rita Monaldi e Francesco Sorti, che definiscono un autogol preferire Boccaccio, che "Ã¨ molto piÃ¹ difficile da digerire, immorale anche dal punto di vista islamico", a Dante che "era inclusivo" e "lascia a porta aperta ai pagani". In difficoltÃ  pare soprattutto la preside dell'istituto Felissent, che si Ã¨ chiusa in una riunione fiume. "Sto cercando di chiarire cosa sia accaduto - ha detto Francesca Magnano - Di certo Ã¨ un errore dire che c'Ã¨ stato un via libera, io non sapevo nulla di questa storia e sto cercando di fare chiarezza con i docenti coinvolti".

author: Oliver Young-Myles
title: Arsenal's defeat to West Ham was a mess of their own making in spite of VAR drama
text:
Arsenal 0-2 West Ham (Soucek 13â€², Mavropanos 55â€², Benrahma missed pen 90+5â€²)
EMIRATES STADIUM â€” Arsenal could yet end 2023 at the top of the Premier League , but a damaging defeat to West Ham will give Mikel Arteta plenty to ponder as he plots a happier end to this season than last.
Another contentious goal will provide fuel to the online conspiracy theorists, but the concession of a second from a set-piece and a panicked response to going behind will worry even the most fervent of Arsenal believers. Nobody expected this.
Thanks to events in Newcastle last month we all know the word that would have been circling around Artetaâ€™s brain after Jarrod Bowen was deemed to have kept the ball alive for Tomas Soucekâ€™s opening goal: Desgracia.
The Spanish term that Arteta used when defending himself against an FA charge after his St Jamesâ€™ Park rant has connotations of misfortune which was apt for this latest VAR-troversy. The worldâ€™s most lucrative league didnâ€™t have a camera angle that could definitively prove that the ball was out of play before Bowen tapped it across goal, and so it had to stand.
Well, well, well!
The Emirates is stunned as West Ham break the deadlock thanks to Tomas Soucek! #PLonPrime #ARSWHU pic.twitter.com/R2T3jkcB1j
â€” Amazon Prime Video Sport (@primevideosport) December 28, 2023 Had he done so a few yards over to the right, goal-line technology would have picked it up. Therein lies the limits of technology in its current guise. Thankfully, Amazon had the foresight to hire Mark Clattenburg to offer his expertise. â€œThe ball looks to be slightly in play,â€ was the sheepish analysis from Saudi Arabiaâ€™s first true footballing trailblazer.
Whether the goal was legitimate or not, it was a mess of Arsenalâ€™s own making, a belated Christmas present gift-wrapped for their grateful opponents.
What followed was entirely predictable: Arsenal domination versus West Ham submission. Defending a one-goal lead is the oldest trick in David Moyesâ€™ book and one that has irked fans of a team featuring the attacking talents of Bowen, Mohammed Kudus and Lucas Paqueta. Fair to say it worked a treat here.
They rode their luck before the break, though. Bukayo Saka forced superhero reflexes from Alphonse Areola before lashing a strike off the base of the post soon after as the Hammers sunk deeper toward the Clock End.
Disaster struck from one of the visitorsâ€™ attempted breakways when Paqueta pulled up less than an hour after receiving treatment during the warm-up, the one negative to an otherwise perfect evening.
Arsenal raced out of the blocks after half-time, racking up the corners and the half chances. Declan Rice, taunted with chants of â€œwhat a waste of moneyâ€ by the fans who used to idolise him, bent a vicious strike inches over the bar after the restart.
The gameâ€™s second goal came from a player facing their former club. Spoiler alert, it wasnâ€™t Rice. Konstantinos Mavropanos made seven Premier League appearances for Arsenal across a forgettable 18-month spell before being moved on and wouldnâ€™t have even played had Kurt Zouma or Nayef Aguerd been available. His hands went up in respectful celebration, but the wide grin betrayed his delight.
Konstantinos Mavropanos silences the Emirates!
The former Arsenal man heads home brilliantly for West Ham's second ðŸ‘ #PLonPrime #ARSWHU pic.twitter.com/KNXA11gGOV
â€” Amazon Prime Video Sport (@primevideosport) December 28, 2023 It was a superb header that satisfyingly caressed the underside of the bar on its way in and one that Gabriel Jesus failed to replicate moments later at the other end. Much as the Brazilian offers his lack of ruthlessness places a limit on Arsenalâ€™s ambition. Ivan Toneyâ€™s reputation is growing each week.
Arteta lobbed one attacking player onto the pitch after another in search of a route back. Leandro Trossard briefly found himself playing as a defensive midfielder. Emile Smith Rowe missed a header, Saka had a penalty appeal waved away, but West Ham saw out the game relatively comfortably to vindicate Moyesâ€™ tactics.
A horrible night for Rice got even worse in added time when he tripped Emerson Palmieri inside his own box. David Raya at least prevented the scoreline from getting any worse, thwarting Said Benrahma from the spot as West Ham fans chanted Riceâ€™s name.
It was the Scotâ€™s first win away at Arsenal in his 23rd attempt. An unforeseen masterclass that will delight his former foes on Merseyside.

author: mdzol.com
title: EscÃ¡ndalo: un cura exigÃ­a a monjas sexo grupal para "crecer espiritualmente" - MDZ Online
text: EscÃ¡ndalo: un cura exigÃ­a a monjas sexo grupal para "crecer espiritualmente" El propio Vaticano publica detalles de la denuncia de las religiosas contra un sacerdote jesuita de alto rango, quien les ordenaba tener relaciones sexuales en grupo. Un artista, tambiÃ©n denunciado. Nuevamente, el catolicismo involucrado en un escandaloso caso que vincula a religiosos con abusos. Esta vez, se trata de un caso en el que hay denuncias por [abusos sexuales](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/abusos-sexuales-7229.html) contra un artista y sacerdote jesuita de alto rango. El religioso de la [Iglesia catÃ³lica](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/iglesia-catolica-137.html) ha sido interpelado por abusar psicolÃ³gica y sexualmente de monjas de su credo. La denuncia llega luego de dos mujeres hablaran pÃºblicamente por primera vez en una rueda de prensa en Roma este miÃ©rcoles, [informÃ³ ](https://www.vaticannews.va/en/vatican-city/news/2024-02/dicastery-doctrine-faith-marko-rupnik-investigation-update.html)Vatican News, agencia de noticias del propio [Vaticano](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/vaticano-161.html). De esta manera, "dos exmonjas revelaron que el excura y ahora artista esloveno Marko Rupnik, de 69 aÃ±os, quien soporta denuncias por abuso de al menos 20 mujeres durante casi 30 aÃ±os en una comunidad religiosa de Eslovenia, las obligaba a mantener sexo con Ã©l en trÃ­o y a ver porno para "crecer espiritualmente". SegÃºn el testimonio de Gloria Branciani, una de las religiosas, Rupnik "me llevaba a cines pornogrÃ¡ficos para ayudarme a 'crecer espiritualmente'. Y aseguraba que yo no crecerÃ­a espiritualmente, hasta que no satisficiera su apetito sexual". AdemÃ¡s, dijo que debiÃ³ hacer [un trÃ­o sexual](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/jesuit-abuse-case-widens-victim-speaks-order-seeks-witnesses-2022-12-19/) con el entonces cura y otra monja, porque segÃºn Ã©l, "era como la Trinidad, refiriÃ©ndose a la [SantÃ­sima Trinidad](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sant%C3%ADsima_Trinidad). Rupnik siempre fue protegido por todos, y todo aquello de lo que se le podÃ­a acusar era minimizado o negado". "Todas Ã©ramos chicas jÃ³venes, llenas de ideales", explicÃ³ la otra denunciante, Mirjiam Kovac: "sin embargo, estos mismos ideales, junto con nuestra formaciÃ³n en la obediencia fueron explotados para cometer abusos de diversa Ã­ndole: de conciencia, de poder, espirituales, psÃ­quicos, fÃ­sicos y a menudo sexuales. Finalmente, luego de aÃ±os de denuncias, el sacerdote Rupnik "fue excomulgado en 2020 por absolver a una mujer con la que habÃ­a tenido relaciones sexuales, uno de los delitos mÃ¡s graves para la Iglesia catÃ³lica. Sin embargo, fue reintegrado dos semanas despuÃ©s, despuÃ©s de arrepentirse", [aporta](https://actualidad.rt.com/actualidad/500066-monjas-denuncian-sacerdote-alto-rango) Rt. Y cierra la agencia recordando que, ya en 2022, las denuncias contra Rupnik hechas por nueve mujeres "fueron desestimadas por el [Dicasterio para la Doctrina de la Fe](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dicasterio_para_la_Doctrina_de_la_Fe), citando el plazo de prescripciÃ³n canÃ³nico. Solo mÃ¡s tarde ese aÃ±o, despuÃ©s de la apariciÃ³n de los informes en la prensa, los jesuitas hicieron un llamado pÃºblico a las vÃ­ctimas para que se presentaran. Rupnik fue finalmente expulsado de la orden en junio de 2023, pero sigue siendo sacerdote y fue aceptado en la diÃ³cesis de Koper, en su Eslovenia natal, en octubre de 2023". Ahora, tras el surgimiento de mÃ¡s testimonios, el [papa Francisco](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/papa-francisco-335.html) decidiÃ³ el pasado mes de octubre reabrir el caso. Video: el papa Francisco pide perdÃ³n por abusos sexuales VaticanNews, Domani, Rt, Afp, Youtube. [](/mundo/2024/2/23/sorprendente-hallazgo-arqueologico-construian-un-metro-surgio-la-maravilla-407891.html) Descubrimiento Sorprendente hallazgo arqueolÃ³gico: construÃ­an un metro y surgiÃ³ la maravilla [](/mundo/2024/2/23/el-balance-de-la-guerra-en-ucrania-dos-anos-de-una-batalla-demasiado-larga-407890.html) Poder bÃ©lico El balance de la guerra en Ucrania: dos aÃ±os de una batalla demasiado larga [](/mundo/2024/2/23/odiseo-aluniza-con-exito-la-primera-mision-de-eeuu-en-mas-de-medio-siglo-407886.html) HistÃ³rico Odiseo: aluniza con Ã©xito la primera misiÃ³n de EE.UU. en mÃ¡s de medio siglo [](/mundo/2024/2/22/grave-incendio-en-valencia-al-menos-muertos-14-heridos-tras-prenderse-fuego-un-edificio-407867.html) Tragedia Valencia: al menos 4 muertos y 14 heridos tras un incendio en un edificio [](/mundo/2024/2/22/asombroso-hallazgo-arqueologico-en-peru-tan-antiguo-como-las-piramides-de-giza-stonehenge-407630.html) Descubrimiento de 5.000 aÃ±os Asombroso hallazgo arqueolÃ³gico en PerÃº, tan antiguo como Giza y Stonehenge [](/mundo/2024/2/22/imagenes-impactantes-un-voraz-incendio-consume-un-edificio-en-valencia-407786.html) Videos ImÃ¡genes impactantes: un voraz incendio consume un edificio en Valencia [](/mundo/2024/2/22/gran-misterio-en-dinamarca-por-que-las-plantas-se-comportan-de-modo-extrano-407640.html) Sin respuesta Gran misterio en Dinamarca: por quÃ© las plantas se comportan de modo extraÃ±o [](/mundo/2024/2/22/rusia-sigue-avanzando-en-ucrania-gano-un-nuevo-poblado-mato-410-soldados-407679.html) Poder bÃ©lico

author: Angus Thomson
title: Northern Beaches Hospital: Health Minister Ryan Park flags changes after death of two-year-old Joe Massa
text: Add articles to your saved list and come back to them any time. Doctors and nurses who treated a two-year-old boy who died at Northern Beaches hospital should have listened to his parents, NSW Health Minister Ryan Park said as he flagged greater scrutiny on the hospitalâ€™s private operators. An investigation into the September death of Joe Massa , two months shy of his second birthday, found serious individual and systemic failures in the hospitalâ€™s management of his soaring heart rate and deteriorating condition in the hours leading up to his cardiac arrest. Elouise and Danny Massa at their North Balgowlah home with a picture of their son Joe, whose shock death at Northern Beaches Hospital in September has left the family demanding answers. Credit: Kate Geraghty Park said the government would urgently enact the recommendations of the review, including changing the electronic medical records system at the hospital to automatically flag when a patientâ€™s vitals are in the â€œred zoneâ€. Park told Sydney radio on Friday morning that he would meet parents Danny and Elouise and Premier Chris Minns on Wednesday â€œto see if there are other things that they might want us to considerâ€, describing the tragedy as â€œa result of failingâ€ to listen to the concerns of his parents. â€œWhat we didnâ€™t do was listen to the people who know their children the best, and that is their mum and their dad,â€ Park told 2GBâ€™s Ben Fordham. â€œThe vast majority of healthcare professionals, including at that hospital, do marvellous work to service millions of patients every year. But on this occasion ... weâ€™ve let the family down, and as a result of that, theyâ€™ve lost a beautiful baby boy, and that is something that we can never fix.â€ Joe Massa died after systemic failures at Northern Beaches Hospital. Park again criticised the decision to run the hospital under a controversial public-private partnership with Australiaâ€™s second-largest private hospital operator, but said the onus was on the government to ensure the safest care for the Northern Beaches community â€œwhile Healthscope are still operatingâ€ the facility. â€œI donâ€™t believe this is the very best model of healthcare ... but parents and the community donâ€™t want to hear that now,â€ he said. â€œThey want to hear what weâ€™re going to try and do to fix it.â€ The hospital is the subject of an investigation by the NSW auditor-general, examining whether it â€œefficiently and effectivelyâ€ delivers public hospital services and quality care. The audit will focus on the emergency department and general surgery, and is expected to be finished by mid-year. On Friday afternoon, federal member for Mackellar, Sophie Scamps called for Northern Beaches Hospital to be â€œreturned to public handsâ€, saying the public private partnership was a â€œfailed experimentâ€ and that â€œpublic health and private profit-making are fundamentally incompatible.â€ Scamps said the state government needed to intervene urgently to end the partnership. â€œPublic hospitals must be publicly run to serve our community, not to make profits for corporations,â€ she said. But blaming the privatisation of the hospital for the incident was â€œa stretch too farâ€, shadow health spokesperson Kellie Sloane said. â€œI think the parents deserve answers, and itâ€™s incumbent upon us to investigate everything thoroughly,â€ Sloane told 2GB on Thursday. Start the day with a summary of the dayâ€™s most important and interesting stories, analysis and insights. Sign up for our Morning Edition newsletter .

author: User
title: My below Powershell script display mail contacts but does NOT display Active Directory nested distribution groups. I do not know why
text:
As far as I know, you cannot directly retrieve nested distribution group names with the Exchange cmdlet Get-DistributionGroupMember . It can retrieve the members of a distribution group, but it does not include members from nested groups.
A possible approach is to use Get-ADGroup from the ActiveDirectory module to retrieve AD groups, including nested groups, and then Get-ADGroupMember $myGroup -Recursive to retrieve all members of the specified group.
# Import-Module Activedirectory $group = Get-ADGroup 'XXX' if($group){ $nestedGroups = Get-ADGroupMember $group -Recursive | Where-Object {$_.objectClass -eq 'group'} $nestedGroups | ForEach-Object {Write-Output "Nested Group: $($_.Name)"} }
4 Here's a similar discussion that shows a slightly different approach to recursively get all mailbox members of the nested groups within a specific group that might come handy.
References:
Get-ADGroup ActiveDirectory Module Get-ADGroupMember Recursively query all members within nested dynamic distribution groups of a regular distribution group

author: T.J. Springer
title: ALERT: Debby moves in, bringing heavy rain/severe threat
text:
ZIP Advertisement ALERT: Debby moves in, bringing heavy rain/severe threat Debby lifts northward and brings impacts for the Valley! Here's the latest from the Storm Team.

IN GETTYSBURG FEELS PRETTY NASTY OUT THAT WAY. AND THAT TORNADIC THREAT, IF ONE WERE TO SPIN UP. POWER OUTAGES ARE POSSIBLE. PONDING ON ROADWAYS IS ALSO EXPECTED AND THEN WITH THE HEAVY RAIN, OUR RIVERS, CREEKS, STREAMS GOING TO BECOME SWOLLEN WITH THE NATURE OF THE RAIN. HEREâ€™S PREDICTOR. SO OVERALL, ITâ€™S A MORE MORNING TO EARLY AFTERNOON EVENT THAN LATER IN THE EVENING EVENT. IN TERMS OF THE FLOODING CONCERNS, WE DO HAVE FLOOD WATCHES THAT HAVE BEEN EXPANDED A BIT NOW INCLUDES ADAMS AND DAUPHIN COUNTY TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. NOW OUR NEWS EIGHT STORM TEAM TEN DAY FORECAST DOES SHOW TEMPERATURES BACK INTO THE LOWER 80S. REALLY A NICE WEEKEND, PLEASANT, REFRESHING. BACK INTO THE MIDDLE 80S. MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE. GOING TO BE HOLDING STRONG. AND THAT REALLY DRIVES OUR FORECAST THROUGH MUC GET LOCAL BREAKING NEWS ALERTS The latest breaking updates, delivered straight to your email inbox.
Your Email Address Submit Privacy Notice Advertisement ALERT: Debby moves in, bringing heavy rain/severe threat Debby lifts northward and brings impacts for the Valley! Here's the latest from the Storm Team.
Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 5:02 PM EDT Aug 8, 2024 T.J. Springer Meteorologist Ethan Huston Meteorologist More rain is on the way as Debby continues to move northward. The clouds today along with showers and a few rumbles will aid in keeping our temps cooler than average. Highs look to rise only into the upper 70s. As we head into tonight, more widespread rain is on the docket as Flood Watches go into effect. Rain looks to fall heavily at times tonight into Friday with 2-4" likely throughout the region. Some of our western neighborhoods could pick up more than that. This makes for swollen waterways across the Valley and the potential for some flooding in lower-lying areas. Be sure to stay weather aware. Another aspect of Debby will be the severe threat. We'll good deal of organizational wind on this side of the storm which makes for some rotating storm potential. The tornado threat is certainly not 0! We'll be watching closely over the next 24 to 36 hours. High pressure builds in behind the remnants of Debby by Saturday and it'll be much quieter. We'll see plenty of sunshine with temps stay below average. It'll be comfier too with highs holding in the lower 80s. That'll combine with dew points in the 50s, making it feel wonderful outdoors. Overall, a stretch of pleasant conditions dominate our weather pattern through the latter half of the 10-Day. We'll see a mix of clouds and sun with highs stay seasonable for this time of year. Have a great day!-T.J. More rain is on the way as Debby continues to move northward. The clouds today along with showers and a few rumbles will aid in keeping our temps cooler than average. Overall, a stretch of pleasant conditions dominate our weather pattern through the latter half of the 10-Day. We'll see a mix of clouds and sun with highs stay seasonable for this time of year.
Have a great day!
